column6: I think they have to go with Plan 1, it's the only thing even close to their budget.
I would recommend Wind energy as the best renewable source that has limited involvement with land layout will not cause water issues in the area and can be placed from from bird habitats
Well now it's a question of which is the most economical,
I really don't like plan 1 for it's high percentage of coal energy, I think it's a really bad idea to be so shortsighted. It's the 21st century, we should be moving beyond coal as much as possible.
They have a "tight" yearly energy budget of 900 million, and plan 1 is the *only* plan under 900 million
Even with the tax credit, plan 2 is the closest to their budget and it's 21.6mil over
It's a question of balancing economy with environmental friendliness, as I interpret it.
From my understanding we are not discussing the plans above but our last written propasal

Yeah I saw that, but also

In this step, you will work together with other Turkers to recommend a way of distributing resources across energy types for the administration of City B. City B requires 12,000,000 MWh electricity a year from four types of energy sources: coal power, wind power, nuclear power and hydro power. We have provided 4 different plans to choose from, each of which emphasizes one energy source as primary.
I think they should be able to offset some of the cost/s for more renewable sources onto the consumers of the energy, but that's not one of our options, sadly.
Yeah I would think we should be discussing the four plans, but the way I read it, they can't afford three of those plans
so it's a moot point?
I dunno
I would assume plans 2, 3, and 4 and going to end up costing tax payers which will make the citizens very upset when there are other options that wont cause taxes to increase
Oh boo to them. Muh taxes... whatever.
Alright so let's say we'll go with plan 1, unless passing the additional expense along to the citizens is an option,
in which case plan 2, because it's the second-cheapest and wind is friendly to their envrionemtn?
